main.name: Derrek Gass
main.description: I recently graduated from CSU, Sacramento with a B.S. in Computer Science.  Data Structures and Algorithms, functional programming, OOP principles, Machine Learning, and Data Visualization... I love it all
main.bio: I'm currently experimenting with Cloud Native applications, serverless architecture, Web Assembly, Rust, and React.
main.contactmessage: Feel free to get in touch with me. I'd love to discuss an opportunitiy to work together.

description: Software engineering, principles of programming languages, data structures, computer architecture, theory of computation and formal languages, operating systems, distributed systems, computer modeling, computer networks, compiler construction, and artificial intelligence.

work.title: Software Engineer - Contract
description: • Spearheaded the front-end development and full-stack integration of an application consisting of flashcard sets, tutorials, and an instructor dashboard to assist special needs educators. I worked across the stack to create a progressive web application built with React.js, Node.js, and Java SpringBoot, continuously deployed to the cloud using the AWS platform.
• Developed automated unit, integration, and functional testing with Selenium in support of our CI/CD pipeline with GitLab, reaching 85% code coverage.

• Drafted our project charter, maintained our product backlog and repository, delegated requirements to team members through scheduling and assignment of tasks, and arranged weekly code reviews and merging of pull requests across multiple teams.
• Facilitated client meetings to understand business objectives, for the purpose of simplifying functional requirements and rendering deliverables well ahead of schedule.

work.title: Software Engineer - Contract
description: • Oversaw the design, prototyping, documentation, and delivery of a web & iOS application for the purposes of automatic student attendance tracking, along with canvas plugin integration.
• Our application has allowed each instructor in the Computer Science program at CSU, Sacramento to save 10 minutes of every class, every day.

work.title: Web Developer - Intern
description: • Bootstrapped a platform as a service for business owners to track online sales, inventory, delivery, and invoicing through a convenient dashboard, including business analytics and real-time monitoring of delivery drivers and customer interactions, while allowing customers a portal to place orders and manage subscriptions with each service provider, and also track the status of each live delivery.
• Developed reusable, responsive UI components with unit and integration testing in support of our business goals, such as driver navigation, live order tracking, and manager dashboards.

projects.title: Indigent Population Statistics - An Exploration with D3.js
projects.category: Interactive Exploration of Homelessness by state

testimonials.text: Derrek is a fast learner who is passionate about a plethora of technologies. He is not afraid of taking on new toolsets in order to better tackle the specific problem he is working on. Being able to choose the right tool for the job while also being willing learn new tech to do it right is a highly desirable quality in a software engineer.

It is quite rare to come across an outstanding and hardworking talent such as Derrek. I have had the pleasure of working with and learning from Derrek for over three years, collaborating on several large team projects. Derrek's ability to find inventive solutions and his immense drive to tackle problems served as both inspiring motivation for the team and as an integral part to increasing the team's productivity. Derrek would be a valuable asset for any team.
Derrek is a passionate programmer with expertise in RESTful web services, cloud application deployment, and is always excited to learn new frameworks and technologies.

Derrek and I attended CSUS together for 2 years and worked on a variety of projects together. Consistently, Derrek impressed me with not only the breadth of knowledge that he possessed, but also his ability to expound upon a variety of technologies and frameworks. Be it backend technologies, front end web frameworks, or dev-ops pipelines, Derrek always seemed to have something extremely valuable to contribute to the conversation. Derrek has very strong technical capabilities, but one of his greatest strengths is his easy-to-get-along-with nature and sociability. Any team that chooses to take Derrek on will be bolstered by his eager attitude towards learning new things and his bright personality.

Derrek and I had 3 classes together (Data Visualization, Intelligent Systems, and Computing Theory & Programming Languages) which involved group projects. In these group projects, Derrek was always the one doing the heavy lifting on the project. He took initiative, and set up the environment, where all we’d have to do is a “git pull.” He would set the roadmap and expectations of the projects, and break it down to digestible chunks for us to contribute features to. Derrek is not only technically skilled, he is also able to articulate the design of our projects in our class presentations, and in each project we’ve done together, we had received A’s. Derrek is also pleasant to work with, and even though we were the same year in school, he was ahead of me technically, and I see him as a mentor. If you want a more in-depth opinion on Derrek, contact me on LinkedIn.

Derrek is highly intelligent with a great eye for detail and understanding of not just the part of a project he is working on, but how that part fits together and integrates with the project as a whole. He is very knowledgeable when it comes to systems design, and optimization and understands how to work well as a part of a team.
